text: Lets you load Lightwave Objects into Houdini.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
The object reader will import a Lightwave Object (LWO2 / LWO3) into Houdini.  Currently Supported
Bones (imported as lines, to make it easy in case you need to actually reconstruct the bones)

UV Maps (imported as vertex attributes - first UV is also renamed to uv (as houdini requires uvs to be named uv, uv1, uv2, uv3, etc.  You can simply add an attribute rename to specify which UVs to use)
absolute & relative Morphs (imported as point attributes - choose setup Moprhs to create a simple morph mixer)
Vertex Color Maps (imported as vertex attributes)
Vertex Normal Maps (imported as vertex attributes)
Materials - LWO2 (pre 2018) Standard material Color hooks, and LWO3 (2018+) will put any images as texture nodes for hookup.  Mantra, Redshift and Octane setup is supported.
Any change in options of the LWO Reader will trigger a reload/resetup of the object.  To avoid this, freeze the Node.
When enabled, will try to find missing textures in Uplevel Directories.
Defines the amount of up levels from where the .lwo folder is located.
Use Specific Search Path (and its SubDirs) - Overrides UpLevel Folders
Ability to use a non relative or absolute path for searching textures.
Search folder of the textures, overwriting the Uplevel setup.

If enabled, skips setting up the material network with all materials/surfaces within.  On each run, a material network is created so make sure
    that if you have consecutive runs, to clean/delete the prior material network.  You can check the shop_materialpath primitive attribute to check which network is being used (it will alwaysy be the latest one)
Specifies the type of material to setup.
Attempts to setup a Bone Network from the imported Bone Primitives
Sets up curves as proper primitives.
Sets up a point wrangle with sliders to control every morph.  All that is needed is a click on the spare parameters button in the wrangle.
Parts taken from Akira Asagi Blender/Maya LWO Importer.

title: OD LWO Object Reader
summary: Lets you load Lightwave Objects into Houdini.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
